post_text: White Site is excited to have students back in classrooms next week.
shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
September 8 at 10:30 AM ·

MECHS will begin Phase Two of our Pandemic Response Plan on September 14th by transitioning into the "Switch-Back Hike" or hybrid model. Students will have the choice of returning to campus or remaining in the virtual learning platform. Students will have the ability to switch from in-person or virtual learning as desired. Each Thursday will be dedicated to virtual learning to make the transition smoother. Be on the lookout for more information and details to come! We can't wait to see you back at school.

post_text:
ATTENTION all Students and Parents:

Due to the current situation and things out of our control MEC will not be going back to face to face learning until September 14th. We started tonight with online learning 4pm until 9pm Monday thru Thursday. This will continue until September 14th. We are now offering a full time online option for our students. For more info on this option please contact the school directly.

post_text:
Congratulations to the White Site
Class of 2020 !

All seniors and their families are invited to the MEC White Site Drive-in Celebration

Thursday, August 20 @ 7:00 p.m. at the White Site

Families are encouraged to decorate their car
Only one car per graduate will be allowed at the celebration
Social Distancing will be in practice/Families will remain with their car during the celebration
Seniors should come in their cap and gown
If you have any questions, please contact
kerry.whitlock@mymec.org
Or
regina.coleman@mymec.org

shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
July 1 at 9:25 AM ·

Meredith Clayton, a dual-enrolled student, plans on finishing her core classes at North Georgia Tech and then attending Nursing school to eventually become a Nurse Practitioner. Meredith’s favorite quote “If it doesn’t challenge you, it won’t change you.” Her favorite memory at MECHS is finishing Algebra ll. Mrs. Brandi Turner is Meredith’s favorite teacher because Mrs. Turner was her 7th-grade teacher at White County Middle school. Then when Meredith saw that Mrs. Turner worked at MECHS, she knew she could go to Mrs. Turner for whatever English questions she had. Dr. Theresa Anderson, one of the counselor’s at MECHS, has been the most helpful for Meredith. No matter what was wrong, Dr. Anderson knew how to fix it. Congratulations Meredith! #classof2020 #senior2020 #graduation2020 #mechsgrad #mechsgrad2020 #mountaineducation #1stchoicefor2ndchance #seniorspotlight

shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
June 24 at 10:37 AM ·

Congratulations to Sarah Eskew from the White Site! Sarah’s future plan is to be a special education para pro. Her favorite quote: "Your only limit is yourself". Sarah’s favorite MECHS memory is the dunk tank fundraiser. She says her favorite teacher was Mrs. Walker because "she will give you her shirt off her back if you needed it and doesn't expect anything in return". We are so proud of you Sarah and wish you the best in your future endeavors. #classof2020 #senior2020 #seniorspotlight #graduation2020 #mechsgrad #mechsgrad2020 #mechsgraduation #mountaineducationcharter #1stchoicefor2ndchance

shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
June 23 at 9:25 AM ·

Congratulations to Grace Teater from the White Site! Grace plans on finishing school at UNG and becoming a clinical therapist. Grace’s favorite quote is, “You don’t get rid of yesterday by talking about it all the time, you get rid of its effects on you by moving forward.” During her time at MECHS, she looked forward to break because she got to talk and mingle with new people. Grace’s favorite staff member is her mentor, Mrs. Ronotta Stiles, "because she has watched me grow up to be the woman I am today." Mrs. Stiles helped when Grace was truly struggling at the bottom. Grace feels that she probably wouldn’t be where she is today without her mentor. We are so proud of you Grace! #classof2020 #senior2020 #seniorspotlight #graduation2020 #mechsgrad #mechsgrad2020 #mechsgraduation #mountaineducationcharter #1stchoicefor2ndchance

shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
June 22 at 10:17 AM ·

Emma Flanagan is a senior from the White Site. Emma plans to attend Lanier Technical College and start her nursing career and hopefully become a surgical nurse. Emma’s favorite memory is when she finally finished her very last module and all the excitement just came flowing through her for finally finishing high school when she thought that would never happen. Mrs. Whitlock is Emma’s favorite staff member because she took the time out of her day or night to help Emma better understand what she was learning at the time. Mr. Tench, the Math teacher in the senior room, was the most helpful teacher for Emma.
Emma’s favorite quote: “I hope the fathers and mothers of little girls will look at them and say ‘yes, women can.” - Dilma Rousseff. Congratulations Emma! We are so proud of you! #classof2020 #graduation2020 #highschoolgraduation #mechsgrad2020 #mechsgrad #senior2020 #seniorspotlight #mountaineducationcharter #1stchoicefor2ndchance

shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
June 9 at 9:07 AM ·

Congratulations to White Site senior Lexi Grindle! Lexi plans to attend college and join the National Guard. She is interested in football, American Sign Language, and sleeping. Her favorite quote: “Love yourself first, because that’s who you’ll spend the rest of your life with." Although Lexi did not attend MECHS very long, her favorite memory is when Sergeant Oakley was a guest speaker and talked to the students about the military. Grad Coach, Mrs. Kerry Whitlock, is her favorite staff member. Lexi’s mentor Mrs. Ronotta Stiles has been the most helpful at MECHS because she would go out of her way to do anything and everything to help Lexi. Great job Lexi, we are so proud of you! #classof2020 #senior2020 #seniorspotlight #mechsgrad #mechsgrad2020 #mountaineducationcharter #1stchoicefor2ndchance #graduation2020

post_text: As we near the end of the 2019-2020 school year MECHS would like to celebrate our students with the Bragging Wagon! We will be providing a drive-thru meal at the site on Thursday, June 4 at 6:00 pm. Students and families, please remain in your vehicle at all times as you drive by and pick up this celebratory meal. In your bag, you will receive a hotdog, little Debbie snack, condiments, and a water bottle.

shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
April 17 at 1:38 PM ·

MECHS is working diligently to provide the safest option for a commencement ceremony for the spring of 2020. Graduation was originally scheduled for May 30th; however, due to the current situation with COVID-19 graduation will either be postponed until later this summer or we will host a virtual ceremony. With that being said, Dr. Lovell and everyone at MECHS would prefer to host traditional graduation with virtual being the absolute last resort. We are working with the University of North Georgia for potential new dates and times. Once we have more guidance from Governor Kemp and the Department of Education, we will communicate that to all of you. Please be assured that graduation will be happening whether at a later date or virtually.

Mountain Education Charter High School
March 30 at 5:17 PM ·

If you find yourself feeling isolated, worried about your family, concerned about being alone at home with children for days or weeks, or in need of essential resources like food or funds for utilities and rent, please call 1-800-CHILDREN (244-5373). MECHS counselors are also available to families and students during this time. Let’s navigate this new normal together.

post_text: All Mountain Education Charter High School locations will remain closed until further notice due to the impact of COVID-19 in our communities. Because national and state information about the coronavirus changes daily, we are unable to make decisions about when school will resume. Online learning will continue Monday through Thursday from 4-9 pm.
text: All Mountain Education Charter High School locations will remain closed until further notice due to the impact of COVID-19 in our communities. Because national and state information about the coronavirus changes daily, we are unable to make decisions about when school will resume. Online learning will continue Monday through Thursday from 4-9 pm.

shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
March 16 at 11:37 AM ·

Mountain Education Charter High School recognizes that the current situation surrounding the Coronavirus may create additional stress for students and their families. In order to provide support for MECHS parents and students while our sites are closed, MECHS will have a counselor or social worker available by phone Monday - Thursday from the hours of 4:00 - 8:00 p.m. Students or parents may reach MECHS support staff by calling 706-219-4664.

Additionally, parents or students may access mental health support 24 hours a day, 7 days a week as needed by calling the Georgia Crisis and Access Line (GCAL) at 800-715-4225 or texting "GA" to 741741.

post_text: Students attended the Career Job Fair held at Truett McConnell University. These students attended two workshops conducted by the Georgia Department of Labor that included topics such as Work Ethics, Interviewing Skills and Job Fair Success. While there students talked with several different businesses that were looking to hire. MECHS also had an informational booth set up.

post_text: As part of an ongoing effort to create opportunities for students to gain perspectives on the job market and learn about different professions, Mountain Education Charter High School (MECHS) regularly invites professionals from a variety of career fields to its campus in Cleveland. On November 19th, MECHS was honored to have Mr. Chuck Little, Human Resources Director for the Atlanta Electrical Contractors Association visit with students and share an exciting opportunity to become a well-paid electrician through their Electrical Apprenticeship Program. “Apprenticeship” means being paid to work full-time, and being sent to school part-time (tuition free). Candidates must have a high school diploma to be eligible for the program. For readers who may be interested themselves, more information can be found on the association’s website at www.atlantaelectrical.org

Candidates must have a high school diploma to be eligible for the program. post_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School held their drawing for the November Attendance awards on November 21, 2019. Students receive a ticket for being in attendance each night and a ticket for each hour they are in attendance each night. At the end of each month MECHS has a special drawing for different Gift Items.
Pictured left to right are: Madison Taylor won a Chick-fil-a Gift Card, Sarah Eskew won a Chick-fil-a Gift Card, Kaden Austin won a Chick-fil-a Gift Card and Levi Jackson won a Kindle Fire Tablet.

post_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School had the Worksource Georgia Career Coach to come recently and work with students in creating a Resume. During this workshop time 24 students were able to learn about, create and save their resumes. The Career Coach is part of the Worksource Georgia of Georgia Mountains Regional Commission.

Pictured are Macy McClendon and Breanna Emory with instructor, Jason Norworthy helping them with their Resume.

is our attendance based incentive program where students earn tickets each day they attend and additional tickets for each hour they attend. These tickets are entered in the monthly drawing held on the last Thursday of each month. September's prize is a Mountain Bike.

post_text:
Please join White County Mountain Education Charter High School in congratulating Wyatt Davis and Anslee Nix for obtaining the honor of Student of the Month!!! The word for this month was PERSEVERANCE.

Mrs. Whitlock nominated Wyatt because he works two jobs, actively cares for his daughter, is responsible about attending school, works hard even when things get difficult, maintains a positive attitude, and making contact with his teachers when he will not be able to attend!

Mr. Ford nominated Anslee Nix because she “works diligently on all of her assignments, is a self-directed learner with a quiet demeanor and determined progress” towards her goals!!!
text:
Please join White County Mountain Education Charter High School in congratulating Wyatt Davis and Anslee Nix for obtaining the honor of Student of the Month!!! The word for this month was PERSEVERANCE.

Mrs. Whitlock nominated Wyatt because he works two jobs, actively cares for his daughter, is responsible about attending school, works hard even when things get difficult, maintains a positive attitude, and making contact with his teachers when he will not be able to attend!

Mr. Ford nominated Anslee Nix because she “works diligently on all of her assignments, is a self-directed learner with a quiet demeanor and determined progress” towards her goals!!!

post_text:
VERY IMPORTANT DATES AT WHITE COUNTY MEC

Re-registration dates-July 25 & 26 4:00-7:00

All current, FULL time MECHS students need to attend with a parent to update all records. For any student over the age of 18, no parent is needed, but we require updated paperwork on you too!

First Day of FALL SEMESTER-August 6

All full-time students must register. If you have not completed a re-registration packet, a new one must be completed prior to attending class for the evening. To save time, please re-register in July.

Also, on August 6, 2018, our hours return to 4:00 pm to 9:00 pm.
text:
VERY IMPORTANT DATES AT WHITE COUNTY MEC

Re-registration dates-July 25 & 26 4:00-7:00

All current, FULL time MECHS students need to attend with a parent to update all records. For any student over the age of 18, no parent is needed, but we require updated paperwork on you too!

First Day of FALL SEMESTER-August 6

All full-time students must register. If you have not completed a re-registration packet, a new one must be completed prior to attending class for the evening. To save time, please re-register in July.

Also, on August 6, 2018, our hours return to 4:00 pm to 9:00 pm.

post_text:
IMPORTANT ANNOUNCEMENT:
It is time for the July End of Course Testing. The schedule is as follows:
MANDATORY REVIEWS

English: Wednesday, July 11, 2018 at 4:00 pm
Geometry: Thursday, July 12, 2018 at 4:00 pm
Social Studies: Monday, July 16, 2018 at 4:00 pm
Science: Tuesday, July 17, 2018 at 4:00 pm
Algebra 1: Wednesday, July 18, 2018 at 4:00 pm.

MANDATORY PRACTICE TEST:

Thursday, July 12, 2018 @ 5:30 pm.

EOC TESTING:
English, Part 1: Monday, July 16, 2018
English, Parts 2 & 3: Tuesday, July 17, 2018
Science and Social Studies: Wednesday, July 18, 2018
Math: Thursday, July 19, 2018.

Any student who does not attend the mandatory review session and practice test will not be allowed to take the EOC test.

There is no makeup session for the month of July.

Please be sure that you attend all of the required reviews.
